JavaScriptReferenceOperatorsNew.target.summary: The new.target meta-property lets you detect whether a function or constructor was called using the new operator. In constructors and functions invoked using the new operator, new.target returns a reference to the constructor or function that new was called upon. In normal function calls, new.target is .
JavaScriptReferenceOperatorsNew.target.value: new.target is guaranteed to be a constructable function value or undefined.
